DOC.brief_summary: The implementation of an enhanced recovery pathway after giant ventral hernia repair, including preoperative high-dose steroid is examined prospectively and compared with a group of historic controls.
DOC.detailed_description: All patients operated on for a large incisional hernia are treated according to the study protocol. Patients are given high-dose glucocorticoid preoperative and the aim is to discharge patients at postoperative day 3. Morbidity, length of stay, pain, nausea and pulmonary function are among registered outcomes compared with a historic control group.
DOC.criteria: Horizontal fascia defect > 10 cm on computed tomography scan Planned elective open incisional hernia repair Known allergy against glucocorticoid treatment Insulintreated diabetes Gastric ulcer diagnosed within four weeks preoperative Steroidtreated immune disease Planned intestinal anastomosis concomitant to hernia repair
